author: Pon Vasanth Arunachalam
text:
Official teams find the money being transported in cars

Cash to the tune of Rs. 10.82 lakh, being transported without appropriate documents, was seized during vehicle checks at two places here on Thursday.

This is the first seizure reported in Madurai district since the Model Code of Conduct (MCC) came into force on Friday last.

Officials said that Rs. 10 lakh was seized near Thathaneri in Madurai South constituency by a flying squad when it intercepted a car in which four persons were travelling.

Inquiry by the officials revealed that the car belonged to a person running a petrol station at Thathaneri. The car along with the cash was taken to the Collectorate for further investigation. As the persons failed to produce documents to show the source of the money, the cash was seized by the officials at the Election Control Room.

A similar incident was reported at Iravadanallur, coming under Madurai South constituency, when one of the static surveillance teams was checking vehicles. The team members found Rs. 82,000 in a car belonging to T. Subramanian, running an auto consultancy business on New Ramnad Road.

Officials said that though the person claimed that he was carrying the money for buying car tyre, he did not have appropriate documents.

As per the Election Commission norms, it is a violation to carry more than Rs. 50,000 without valid documents when the MCC is in force.

Collector and Election Officer K. Veera Raghava Rao told The Hindu that the cash would be deposited in treasury. “To claim the money back, they should provide documents showing the source of the money. A three-member committee would scrutinise the documents and decide whether the money can be released or not.”
title: Rs. 10.82 lakh unaccounted money seized in Madurai
